item.item: Details about the site in which the CWR population was observed and/or the accession/specimen collected.
Whether any monitoring of the site is foreseen across years.
Who is in charge of the monitoring.
Name of nearest place to site. This also refers to places that may not have proper names (i.e. road junctions).
Distance from nearest named place to site.
Direction of site from nearest named place in degrees relative to North.
Information on the climate map source and/or distance to the site from the meteorological station.
Description of unit (e.g. Permanent mesotrophic pastures and aftermath-grazed meadows).
Authority file to which the habitat refers.
Authority file to which the habitat refers (e.g. EUNIS habitat types).
Version of authority file used (e.g. June 2012).
Whether any monitoring of the site is foreseen across years.
Other conserved area, not protected by legislation
WDPA unique site code. Site code is available from the World database of protected areas (WDPA) (http://www.wdpa.org/ ).
Description of the geomorphology of the immediate surroundings of the collecting site (adapted from FAO, 1990).
Bottom position in flat or almost-flat terrain.
Estimated slope of the site in degrees.
The direction that the slope faces, with symbols N, S, E, W (e.g. a slope that faces a south-western direction has an aspect of SW).
Moisture conditions prevailing in the soil.
Depth in centimetres at which soil moisture condition was recorded.
Actual measurement of soil salinity content in ppm at related depth.
Depth in centimeters at which soil salinity measurement was taken.
